content.question: Let f be the function given by f ( x ) = ln x x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ED6@   for all x  >  0 . The derivative of f is given by f ′ ( x ) = 1 − ln x x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4192@ . (a) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at x = e 2 .

frqParts.text: Let f be the function given by f ( x ) = ln x x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ED6@   for all x  >  0 . The derivative of f is given by f ′ ( x ) = 1 − ln x x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4192@ . (a) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at x = e 2 .
(b) Find the x-coordinate of the critical point of f. Determine whether this point is a relative minimum, a relative maximum, or neither for the function f. Justify your answer.
(c) The graph of the function f has exactly one point of inflection. Find the x-coordinate of this point.

topic.text: 1.14: Connecting Infinite Limits and Vertical Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
